intro: Psychotria brevicollis, commonly known as the short-necked psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, dark blue to black berries that are toxic to humans and animals. Psychotria brevicollis is often found in shaded, humid environments such as rainforests and undergrowth.
